sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.description:
Allows to visualize source code of various types with syntax highlighting, line numbers in editable and read only mode.
Use this controls in scenarios where the user should be able to inspect and edit source code.
sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CodeEditor. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getType type} : string (default: javascript)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLineNumbers lineNumbers} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getValueSelection valueSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getColorTheme colorTheme} : string (default: default)
    • {@link #getSyntaxHints syntaxHints} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.codeeditor.CodeEditor.helpDescription:
Allows to visualize source code of various types with syntax highlighting, line numbers in editable and read only mode.
Use this controls in scenarios where the user should be able to inspect and edit source code.

layoutData.description:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

models.description:
A map of model instances to which the object should be attached.
The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

lineNumbers.description: Sets whether line numbers should be shown
lineNumbers.helpDescription: Sets whether line numbers should be shown

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control

syntaxHints.description: Sets whether to show syntax hints the editor. This flag is only available if line numbers are shown.
syntaxHints.helpDescription: Sets whether to show syntax hints the editor. This flag is only available if line numbers are shown.

objectBindings.description:
A map of model instances to which the object should be attached.
The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

editable.description: Sets whether the code in the editor can be changed by the user
editable.helpDescription: Sets whether the code in the editor can be changed by the user

valueSelection.description: Sets whether the code is automatically selected if a value is set
valueSelection.helpDescription: Sets whether the code is automatically selected if a value is set

type.description:
The type of the code in the editor used for syntax highlighting
Possible types are javascript (default), json, html, xml and  css.
type.helpDescription:
The type of the code in the editor used for syntax highlighting
Possible types are javascript (default), json, html, xml and  css.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.

width.description: The width of the code editor
width.helpDescription: The width of the code editor

colorTheme.description:
Sets the editors color theme
possible values
colorTheme.helpDescription:
Sets the editors color theme
possible values

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.
If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

value.description: The value displayed in the code editor
value.helpDescription: The value displayed in the code editor

height.description:
The height of the code editor.
A minimal height of 3rem will be applied in case the height is less than 20px.
height.helpDescription:
The height of the code editor.
A minimal height of 3rem will be applied in case the height is less than 20px.

bindingContexts.description:
A map of model instances to which the object should be attached.
The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

formatError.name: formatError
formatError.description:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model,
but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.helpDescription:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model,
but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

liveChange.name: liveChange
liveChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

change.name: change
change.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

parseError.name: parseError
parseError.description:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model,
but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.helpDescription:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model,
but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationSuccess.name: validationSuccess
validationSuccess.description:
Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model.
Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.helpDescription:
Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model.
Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.name: modelContextChange
modelContextChange.description: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or the user explicitly pressed a validation key combination. Use this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#setFieldGroupIds}.
validateFieldGroup.helpDescription: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or the user explicitly pressed a validation key combination. Use this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#setFieldGroupIds}.
validateFieldGroup.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationError.name: validationError
validationError.description:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model,
but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.helpDescription:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model,
but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
